alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 21 at 3:23PM MDT until June 21 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN KIMBALL AND SOUTHEASTERN LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 322 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Panorama Point, or 20 miles southwest of Kimball, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Panorama Point and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 399 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 11. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska...and southeastern Wyoming. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
